lines: A signal flickers across the virtual skyline: REPLY.
You wrote a melody you cannot remember composing.
You send the reply into the quiet.
A pulse returns, faint but familiar.
You keep the memory close, like a hidden key.
The room warms. The track asks to be finished.
The rehearsal room hums like a distant moon.
Your hands move before your thoughts can follow.
Every note feels older than you are.
If the song lands, the loop will close.
